item.title: Ramp drop curb blocked, 11th August
item.description:
Blocking ramp so I can’t get a Electric wheelchair down , there is lots off parking on Leda road on Woolwich dockyard, why park blocking a ramp so I can’t get down there , I can’t walk need to use this

item.title: Gate not shutting and needs oiling, 11th August
item.description:
Hinges extremely loud and screechy. Gate will not lock despite the advice on the “close gates after use” sign. Hinges need oiling and gate needs aligning

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 62a, East Dulwich Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose Manhole Cover, 11th August
item.description:
As explained by several other residents there is a loose man hole cover. It is dangerous and not to mention a nuisance when it comes to noise pollution. Can we please have someone look at this urgently and look to find a permanent fix for it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Boundary Lane, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unswept Roads, 11th August
item.description:
The traffic light islands at the junction of Brampton Road / Danson Road at Crook Log have not been properly cleaned in months. A deep accumulation of cigarette butts and debris has built up around these islands. Please arrange for a proper cleanup at these junctions asap.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 184, Rydal Drive, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Southwark Council’s public litter bin removed or stolen, 11th August
item.description:
Southwark Council’s public litter bin has been removed or stolen. Please could you review and reinstate the bin so that rubbish is not thrown on the floor due to the absence of the bin. A similar issues was raised previously but marked as closed and resolved. For clarity, the bin that has been removed is not a private bin, it is a public Southwark bin that has been removed. The previous response was: “Thank you for reporting this matter. Following our investigation, no action can be taken because it is the responsibility of non-local authority or privately owned/operated organisation. Your case is closed.” However, if Southwark have appointed a private third party to provide public litter bins on public pavements/footpaths, please could you clarify the position and identify the entity responsible. Thank you in advance for reinstating the public litter bin. As requested by Southwark, a new report was opened rather than updating a previous report “If this problem is still ongoing, please open a new report instead of updating this one.”

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 296-301, Tanner Street, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Every bin in goose green has overflown, 11th August

item.title: Cement on roadway and soil deposit on footway, 11th August
item.description:
Between 58 to 64 Maple Crescent there is a large amount of dried cement on the road and soil deposits on the pavement as a result of building work being undertaken. Please can this be deep cleaned to clear the mess. The roadway may need to be washed down.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maple Crescent, Blackfen, London

item.title: Faulty traffic light sequences at this junction present dangerous situations. The safety issue is that traffic from Southwood Road are put into direct conflict with traffic turning right into Green Lane because of faulty traffic lights sequence. The solution is to ensure the traffic l9ights do not turn green until sufficient time has elapsed for the traffic turning right into Green Lane. Another option is for a green filter on A20 Sidcup road for traffic turning right into Green Lane toavoid the conflict., 11th August
item.description:
As above
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southwood Road, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
